doc.after: The primary biome of inland Massachusetts is temperate deciduous forest 73 Although much of Massachusetts had been cleared for agriculture leaving only traces of old growth forest in isolated pockets secondary growth has regenerated in many rural areas as farms have been abandoned 74 Currently forests cover around 62 of Massachusetts 75 The areas most affected by human development include the Greater Boston area in the east and the Springfield metropolitan area in the west although the latter includes agricultural areas throughout the Connecticut River Valley 76 There are currently 219 endangered species in Massachusetts 77
